message: i wonder if I kept it in my great writing book purge
It was great cause Rosenblatt said he couldn't necessarily teach people to be good writers, but he could teach them to be BETTER writers.
some of the ones i remember liking
"Unless It Moves The Human Heart: The Craft and Art of Writing," http://www.pbs.org/newshour/art/blog/2011/01/mondays-newshour-roger-rosenblatt-has-advice-for-writers.html
Oh yes, I've heard of that one. Supposed to be good.
Also, Graywolf Press has a wonderful series of writing books known as "The Art Of" series. Each short book covers a different topic: point of view, time, etc.
Great. Had you heard about the one above by Rosenblatt?

Currently, I'm reading Style: Towards Clarity and Grace, which is very good. Although it's not for beginners. Instead, you might start with Elements of Style by S&W, and then read On Writing Well by Zinnser. Also, I've started a writing group: https://convore.com/writing/.
Stephen King's 'On Writing' - mostly deals with his writing process and some advice
